Uses of Class
filesystem.Directory

  • Packages that use Directory 
    Package Description
    filesystem  
    unitTests  

    • Uses of Directory in filesystem

      Methods in filesystem that return Directory 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Directory Directory.createAndAddNewDir(java.lang.String name)
      Adds a given directory as a child of this directory if the directory does not already exist.
      Directory Directory.getChildDirectoryByName(java.lang.String name)
      Returns a child directory by name.
      Directory InMemoryFileSystem.getDirByPath(Path path)
      Provides directory located at given path to the caller.
      Directory FileSystem.getDirByPath(Path path)
      Gets a directory by the given path.
      Directory FSElement.getParent()
      Provides the parent of this element.
      Directory Directory.getParent()
      Gets the parent of this directory.
      Directory InMemoryFileSystem.getRoot()
      Getter for the root directory.
      Directory FileSystem.getRoot()
      Gets the root directory of the file system.
      Directory InMemoryFileSystem.getWorkingDir()
      Getter for the working directory.
      Directory FileSystem.getWorkingDir()
      Gets the current working directory.
      Methods in filesystem with parameters of type Directory 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void FSElement.changeParent(Directory newParent)
      Sets the current fselement's parent to newParent.
      Constructors in filesystem with parameters of type Directory 
      Constructor and Description
      Directory(java.lang.String name, Directory parent)
      Creates a new directory given the name of the directory and its parent.
      File(java.lang.String name, Directory parent)
      Create a new file with the given name, and empty contents.
      File(java.lang.String name, T contents, Directory parent)
      Create a new file given a name and the contents of the file.
      FSElement(java.lang.String name, Directory parent)
      Constructs a new element.
